column4: oh, the weirde IP address was just where I was opening the firewall
the firewall has its own IP address?
this is so much easier on my home network with my linksys router
this is some BS att webinterface thingy
this interface says NOTHING about port forwarding.  My linksys has PORT FORWARDING, which makes sense...this thing is completely idiotic.

there is a place to p" open the firewall"  to allow " applications"  through (ssh is listed in " application" , and it says "Choose the computer that will host applications through the firewall:"  lists 2 ip addresses, ne\ither of which is this machine
just tell us the exact model
you want on PC to have inbound traffic routed to it? Is that what you are going for?
strangely that is how your computer and the router communicate - through those IP addresses
either the router gives the PC an address (dhcp) or you create a static address on the PC and the router accepts that
